page.title: 03 Working in Irthlingborough.
page.content: One of these local industries was iron ore mining.The land in east Northamptonshire is rich in ironstone hence the steel works at Corby .The ore mined in our area fed these steel works.Around Irthlingborough the ore was tunnel mined and the resulting tunnels have caused many problems.The danger of subsidence makes much of the land unsafe for building. The mines were worked for about one hundred years and finally closed in the mid 60's.The other main source of employment was the shoe and leather industries.At one time we had 9 shoe and leather producing factories, but now there are only 2 or 3 closing rooms and 3 or 4 leather makers.The main employer now is Whitworths who have a large dry goods packaging plant here. Now, Irthlingborough is mostly a dormitory town.
